basics.name: Gulnara Zaynutdinova
basics.summary: Associate Professor of Finance at West Virginia University. Research in empirical asset pricing, institutional investors, market efficiency, corporate governance, and responsible investing.

work.name: West Virginia University, John Chambers College of Business and Economics
work.summary: Faculty member in the Department of Finance.

publications.name: When Does the Fed Care About Stock Prices?
publications.publisher: Journal of Banking and Finance, Forthcoming
publications.summary: Monetary policy response to stock market conditions using intraday and futures data.

publications.name: Stock Selection Timing
publications.summary: Mutual fund trading timing and performance implications.

publications.name: Corporate Governance and Cash Holdings: Evidence from Worldwide Board Reforms
publications.summary: Governance reforms and their effect on cash holdings and cash usage.

publications.name: Climate Risk Perception and Mutual Fund Flows: Implications for Performance
publications.summary: Climate-news-sensitive fund flows and return predictability.

teaching.description: Corporate finance foundations including valuation, capital budgeting, and financing decisions.
Portfolio theory, asset pricing, and institutional market structure.
